newsitem.title: USA: Glimcher Realty to get Nomura investment.
newsitem.headline: Glimcher Realty to get Nomura investment.

text.p: Glimcher Realty Trust said on Tuesday it has entered into a development and investment agreement with Nomura Asset Capital Corp, a U.S. affiliate of Nomura Securities Co Ltd.
Nomura agreed to provide funding for the Great Mall of the Great Plains and a $135 million securities purchase deal to fund additional regional mall developments, Glimcher said.
Under the agreement, Nomura has completed an initial purchase of 34,000 shares of preferred stock from Glimcher Realty Trust at a cost of approximately $34.0 million, Glimcher said.
Proceeds from the offering have been invested in The Great Mall of the Great Plains development, a $110 million project located in the Kansas City region, the company said.
Glimcher will receive a preferred return, after which profits will be split among the participants in accordance with their share of project ownership, the company said.
Both Glimcher and Nomura have a 45 percent share in the venture, the remaining 10 percent share is held by a minority partner, the company said.

In addition, Nomura has made a forward commitment to provide permanent financing to replace the current construction loan once the project is finalized, Glimcher said. Glimcher will provide leasing, management, and construction services for the project.
